Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.misc.functions

Class LambertW

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.misc.functions.LambertW
public class LambertW extends Object
This class provides an implementation of the Lambert W function, commonly used in mathematical computations involving non-algebraic equations. The function is defined as the inverse of f(W) = W * exp(W). It supports both the principal branch (W0) and the -1 branch (W-1).

  • Method Details

    • W

      public double W(int j, double z, double tolerance) throws LambertW.LambertException
      See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lambert_W_function See also https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/1700919/how-to-derive-the-lambert-w-function-series-expansion
      Parameters:
      j - the branch.
      z - the (real) z-value.
      tolerance - the tolerance which controls the convergence of the approximation.
      Returns:
      the value of Wj(z)
      Throws:
      LambertW.LambertException - if j or z is out of range.
      RuntimeException - if the function doesn't converge to within the required tolerance.

    • W

      public Double[] W(double z, double tolerance)
      Computes the Lambert W function for all valid branches for a given real z-value and specified tolerance. This method internally calls another W function for each branch (j = 0, j = -1) and collects the results. If a branch computation fails due to a LambertException, it is ignored.
      Parameters:
      z - the (real) z-value for which the Lambert W function is computed.
      tolerance - the tolerance that controls the convergence of the approximation.
      Returns:
      an array of Double containing the computed values of the Lambert W function for the valid branches.
